alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 10:59AM CST until March 15 at 10:48AM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. .Minor flooding is ongoing along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White rivers and several tributaries across central and southern Indiana due to 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall that fell Friday March 3rd. Flooding is ongoing along the full length of the Wabash River with the crest near Covington. Much of the White River is in flood from Spencer to Hazleton, with the crest near Elliston. Flooding along the East Fork White River is expected from Seymour to Williams, with the crest near Seymour. Flooding along many smaller tributaries that has not already ended will end by Tuesday. Flooding will continue through the middle to end of the week along portions of the Wabash, White and East Fork White, and into next week on lower portions of these rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, MARCH 15... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, March 15. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Higher rural roads begin to flood. High water isolates many river cabins. Seep water becomes a problem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Monday /11:00 AM EST Monday/ the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Monday /11:00 AM EST Monday/ was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.2 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, March 14. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
